Package com.comp413.clientapi.api

Class ClientApiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp413.clientapi.api.ClientApiController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @RequestMapping("api") public class ClientApiController extends Object
Requests are made here and routed through the server.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> login(@RequestBody credentialsRequest request)
      When providing matching credentials (username, password), a user is granted access to all the services in the Stock Trading platform. This WILL SOON begin a new session (create a local cookie) for the user and allow them to perform all the requests specific to their user.
      Parameters:
      request - User credentials request body consists of a username and password pair
      Returns:
      Upon successful login (currently this is EVERY login) the response yields a 200 OK status.

    • register

      @PostMapping("/login/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> register(@RequestBody credentialsRequest request)
      A new user may register with the Stock Trading service by providing a credential pair consisting of a unique username and a password.
      Parameters:
      request - User credentials request body consists of a username and password pair
      Returns:
      Upon successful user creation (currently this is EVERY registration) the response yields a 201 CREATED status and a brief message. It WILL SOON return an error if the requested account credentials collide with those of an already-existing user.

    • placeOrder

      @PostMapping("/order/placeOrder/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> placeOrder(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId, @RequestBody orderRequest request)
      A user can make a market order by providing the necessary details. FOR NOW the order details are passed directly to the FinSim which will process the order.
      Parameters:
      request - Order request contains all the details necessary for an order. A user must specify the following for a valid order request: - (enum OrderType) side - (long) portfolioId - (String) ticker - (int) quantity - (Side) side - (float) price
      Returns:
      If the order is successful, the response yields a brief message and a 201 CREATED status.

    • cancelOrder

      @DeleteMapping("/order/cancelOrder/{orderId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> cancelOrder(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId, @PathVariable String orderId)
      Cancel a given user's order provided their session cookie and order identifier.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - Session cookie of logged-in user.
      orderId - Unique identifier of order
      Returns:
      Upon success the response yields a brief message and a 200 OK status code. Upon failure a brief message describing the failure is returned.

    • getPFValue

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getPFValue/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getPFValue(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId)
      Provide a valuation of a user's portfolio on their dashboard.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - Session cookie of logged-in user.
      Returns:
      Double value representing a portfolio's value.

    • getCash

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getCash/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getCash(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId)
      Provide the total amount of cash on-hand in a user's account.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - Session cookie of logged-in user.
      Returns:
      Double value representing a user's cash.

    • getStock

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getStock/{symbol}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getStock(@PathVariable String symbol)
      Fetch data regarding an entity with the provided symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the relevant asset (e.g., stock ticker GOOG)
      Returns:
      an object holding the data of the stock. It is serialized into JSON upon receipt.

    • getStockHistory

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getStockHistory/{symbol}&{range}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getStockHistory(@PathVariable String symbol, @PathVariable timeRange range)
      Fetch data regarding an entity with the provided symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the relevant asset (e.g., stock ticker GOOG)
      Returns:
      an object holding the data of the stock. It is serialized into JSON upon receipt.

    • getTransactionHistory

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getTransactionHistory/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Order>> getTransactionHistory(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId)
      Query for all of a user's completed transactions (filled orders).
      Parameters:
      sessionId - cookie
      Returns:
      A list of transaction objects are returned. They are serialized into JSON upon receipt.

    • getPendingOrder

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getPendingOrders/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Order>> getPendingOrder(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId)
      Query for all of a user's open orders (pending orders).
      Parameters:
      sessionId - Session cookie of logged-in user.
      Returns:
      a list of order objects are returned. They are serialized into JSON upon receipt.

    • getCancelledOrder

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getCancelledOrders/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Order>> getCancelledOrder(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId)
      Query for all of a user's cancelled orders.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - Session cookie of logged-in user.
      Returns:
      a list of order objects are returned. They are serialized into JSON upon receipt.

    • getHoldings

      @GetMapping("/dashboard/getHoldings/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Holding>> getHoldings(@CookieValue("STSESSIONID") String sessionId)
      Query for all of a user's holdings.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - Session cookie of logged-in user.
      Returns:
      A user's full list of holdings.
